text:
Err
Gentre

GROUP RESEARCH ANO DEVELOPMENT CENTRE GAITISH-AMERICAN TOBACCO COMPANY LIMITED.
REGENTS PARK ROAO, SOUTHAMPTON, ENGLAND, $09 1PE
Telephone (0703) 777621 Telex 477269

Poser. R & D Dept.

toe DGF/AIW/2.3.1 st December, 1975

Dr. R. C. Hockett,

Council for Tobacco Research ~ USA Inc.,
110 East 59th Street,

New York,

N.Y. 10022,

U.S.A.

Dear Bob,
Professor Pekka Soila

On Friday last (28th November), at the request of the
General Manager of our Finnish Associate Company (Suomen Tupakka),
Mr. Gwynn Hargrove (whom I think you know ~ he is our Public
Relations Manager at Millbank) and I met a distinguished Finnish
Professor of Radiology, Professor Pekka Soila, who was in Londo
en route for a visit to the U.S.A. As you may know, there is no
Finnish industry organisation equivalent to CTR or TRC.

 

Professor Soila is of the firm opinion that the
incidence of bronchial carcinoma in Finland, attributed to
cigarette smoking, has been grossly over-emphasised. He made
the claims that

a) Smokers of less than 15 cigarettes a day do not attain
the threshold of risk.

b) The risk of lung cancer for smokers (overall?) was not
1 in 9, but only 1 in 200.

Professor Soila drew our attention to the comprehensive
nature of the biomedical statistics maintained in all Scandanavian
countries, including Finland, and their ready accessibility to
bona-fide researchers.

He was, apparently, looking for support for a prospective
survey of a section of the population and for a comparison between
the various Nordic Countries - Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Finland
(and Iceland? - he mentioned five countries). He was not aware
of the recent Swedish 10-year follow up survey of 50,000 people
by Cederléf, Friberg, Hrubec and Lorich of the Karolinska
Institute.

Dear Bob, Professor Pekka Soila On Friday last (28th November ), at the request of the General Manager of our Finnish Associate Company (Suomen Tupakka ), Mr. Gwynn Hargrove (whom Atomic number 53 think you know ~ he is our Public Relations Manager at Millbank) and I meet a distinguished Finnish Professor of Radiology, Professor Pekka Soila, who was in Londo en route for a visit to the U. S. A. As you may know, there is no Finnish industry organisation equivalent to CTR or TRC. Professor Soila is of the firm opinion that the incidence of bronchial carcinoma in Finland, attributed to cigarette smoking, has been grossly over - emphasised. He made the claims that a) Smokers of less than 15 cigarettes a day do non attain the brink of risk. b) The risk of lung cancer for smokers (overall?) was not 1 in 9, but only 1 in 200. Professor Soila drew our attention to the comprehensive nature of the biomedical statistics maintained in all Scandanavian countries, including Finland, and their ready accessibility to bona - fide researchers. He was, apparently, looking for support for a prospective survey of a section of the population and for a comparison between the various Nordic Countries - Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Finland (and Iceland? - he mentioned five countries ). He was not aware of the recent Swedish 10 - year follow up survey of 50, 000 multitude by Cederléf, Friberg, Hrubec and Lorich of the Karolinska Institute.

summary: Professor Pekka Soila is of the firm opinion that bronchial carcinoma in Finland has been grossly over-emphasised. Smokers of less than 15 cigarettes a day do not attain the threshold of risk. The risk of lung cancer for smokers (overall?) was not grotesque1 in 9, but only 1 in 200. He was, apparently, looking for support for a prospective survey of a section of population.
